module.p: bliadhna year is a feminine temporal unit noun.

Examples from Gairm –
Bha i ceud bliadhna a dh’ aois is esan dhà air fhichead. Cha robh e ach mìos no dhà a-mach ás an oilthigh. Bha a nighean a’ fuireachd còmhla rithe. Bha ise ceithir fichead. Shaoil e gu robh a’ chailleach ann an dòigh na bu shunndaiche na a nighean. [...]
She was a hundred years old and him twenty two. He was just a month or two out of the university. Her daughter was living with her. She was eighty. He thought that the old woman was in a way livelier than her daughter. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
[...] “Rinn e òran dhomh. Oran briagha. [...] Cha robh sinn ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. [...] ’Se Sasunnach a bh’ ann [...] Cha robh e ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. Balach àrd tapaidh le léine shìoda. Thubhairt e rium gum pòsadh e mi.” [...]
[...] “He sang me a song. A beautiful song. [...] We were just twenty years of age. [...] He was just twenty years of age. A tall strong boy with a silk shirt. He said to me that he would marry me.” [...] td. 170, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
[...] “Rinn e òran dhomh. Oran briagha. [...] Cha robh sinn ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. [...] ’Se Sasunnach a bh’ ann [...] Cha robh e ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. Balach àrd tapaidh le léine shìoda. Thubhairt e rium gum pòsadh e mi.” Thòisich i a’ crònan fonn a bha cumanta bliadhnachan air ais—air feadh an t-samhraidh ud.[...]
[...] “He sang me a song. A beautiful song. [...] We were just twenty years of age. [...] He was just twenty years of age. A tall strong boy with a silk shirt. He said to me that he would marry me.” She started to hum a melody that was popular years ago – all through that summer. [...] td. 170, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
[...] Dh’fhàs a guth na bu làidir. “Tha aon rud cinnteach, chan fhalbh aon choigreach le mo leanabh. Cha teid i gu aon dannsa, tha sin cinnteach. Tha. Tha. Na bi smaoineachadh gun teid, a leanaibh. Chan eil fhios agad mu ’n deidhinn, mar a th’ agamsa.” “Carson nach do bhàsaich thu o chionn leth-cheud bliadhna,” dh’ éigh Màiri. Bha i smaoineachadh air na gnothaichean ud fhathast! “Greas ort leis an tea,” ars a màthair. [...]
[...] Her voice grew louder. “One thing is certain, not one stranger will leave [go out?] with my child. She will not go to a single dance, that is certain. It is. It is. Do not be thinking that you will, child. You don’t know about them, as I do.” “Why did you not die fifty years ago,” shouted Mary. She was still thinking about those matters! “Hurry up with the tea,” said her mother. [...] td. 171, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. [...]
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. [...] td. 297, ‘Air An Spiris’ abstract
[...] A thaobh ciùil, nach bu chòir do ’n Bh.B.C. a bhith ceum air thoiseach air càch, a’ deilbh dhòighean is chruthan ùra, gun dearmad a dhèanamh air na rudan luachmhor a tha nar dìleab? Tha aca ri sùil a chumail air an aois ’s air an òigridh, agus chan eil sinn gun dòchas gun tarraing iad air ais bho shloc nan daolagan pàirt de òigridh na Gàidhlig, agus gu seall iad dhaibh nach do chaill ceòl nan Gaidheal a’ bhuaidh a bha aige air ar sluagh fad cheudan bliadhna. [...]
[...] On the subject of music, shouldn’t the BBC be a step ahead of the rest, producing new methods and forms, without neglecting the valuable things that are in our inheritance? They have to keep an eye on old age and on the youth, and we are not without hope that they will pull back part of Gaelic-speaking youth from the pit of beetles, and that they will show them that the Gael’s music has not lost the effect that ithas had on our people for hundreds of years. [...] td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’
cf. deich-bhliadhnail decennial, every ten years.
